channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Bridgend river death: Police keep 'open mind' after boy, 5, dies
item.description: The boy was found after police were called to reports of a missing child on Saturday morning.

item.title: Cardiff Park Plaza fire: Four rescued from flat above hotel
item.description: The blaze happened in a private flat above Cardiff's Park Plaza Hotel, sparking an evacuation.

item.title: Police attend 'serious incident' at holiday park near Abergele
item.description: A spokesman for the holiday park says they are "shocked and saddened" by the "tragic incident".

item.title: Covid: Cardiff ice rink to reopen after 'frustrating' wait
item.description: One of Wales' two ice rinks is to open for the first time in 17 months as the other remains shut.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Welsh swimmer Daniel Jervis eyes British record after finishing fifth
item.description: Daniel Jervis believes he will soon break fellow Welshman David Davies' British record for the 1500m freestyle after finishing fifth at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Body-worn cameras for Denbighshire council staff after abuse
item.description: A man has been arrested after a parking warden was allegedly racially abused after issuing a ticket.

item.title: Sikh and Hindu ashes scattering site opens in Cardiff
item.description: A dedicated site for ashes to be scattered into flowing water is officially opened in Cardiff.

item.title: Dyfed-Powys Police appoints new chief constable
item.description: Richard Lewis is to return to the force after taking up the role with troubled Cleveland Police in 2019.

item.title: Pontypridd: Knife found as man hurt in town centre 'altercation'
item.description: Police are investigating after a knife was recovered after an "altercation" between three men.

item.title: Covid: Furlough cut 'could push businesses off cliff edge'
item.description: Making businesses pay more towards furlough could lead to job losses, unions warn.

item.title: Crickhowell rape: Police search for masked men after woman attacked
item.description: The "harrowing" early hours attack happened as she walked on the main road in a small rural town.

item.title: South Africa 27-9 British and Irish Lions: Springboks level series in fiery encounter
item.description: The British and Irish Lions' series with South Africa will go to a decider after the Springboks win a fiery second Test 27-9 at Cape Town Stadium.

item.title: Mobo: Welsh music of black origin project started to 'help give back'
item.description: The new project will allow five singers and producers to be mentored by music professionals.

item.title: Bradley John 'should be coming up to his 18th birthday'
item.description: Father of Bradley John, 14, says the fact he "took his life" at school is "very, very symbolic".

item.title: Talking Books Wales: How one woman helped so many blind people read
item.description: After losing her sight in her 30s, Rhian Evans says she "used that disability" to help others.

item.title: LGBTQ people 'need to be part of' Wales' awareness push
item.description: It is hoped a new plan will see LGBTQ+ rights made mainstream across schools and the public sector.

item.title: Welsh slate landscape crowned a World Heritage site
item.description: The slate landscape of north-west Wales becomes the 32 UK site to be on Unesco's heritage list.

item.title: Woman who died in 'severe' pain at Cardiff home waited 'hours' for ambulance
item.description: John Whale's wife Maria died after they waited more than two hours for an ambulance.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Head coach Warren Gatland says third Test like a 'cup final'
item.description: British and Irish Lions head coach Warren Gatland says the deciding third and final Test against South Africa next Saturday will be a "cup final".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Hannah Mills and Eilidh McIntyre 'sick with nerves' in chase for sailing gold
item.description: Olympic champion Hannah Mills says she and partner Eilidh McIntyre have been "feeling sick with nerves every single day" as they go for gold in the women's 470 sailing.

item.title: Russell Martin: MK Dons manager's style would suit Swansea City, says Alan Tate
item.description: Caretaker manager Alan Tate believes Russell Martin's football philosophy makes him an ideal fit for Swansea City.

item.title: Cardiff Rugby go back to the future to begin post-Blues new era
item.description: Cardiff Rugby go back to the future to begin a new era after changing their name from Cardiff Blues.

item.title: Osian Roberts: Ex-Wales assistant set to join Patrick Vieira at Crystal Palace
item.description: Former Wales assistant manager Osian Roberts is set to join Crystal Palace as number two to Patrick Vieira.

item.title: Achub pedwar o bobl yn dilyn tân mewn fflat yng Nghaerdydd
item.description: Achub tri phlentyn ac un oedolyn yn dilyn tân mewn fflat uwchben Gwesty Park Plaza yn y brif ddinas.

item.title: Heddlu'n 'cadw meddwl agored' am farwolaeth bachgen ifanc
item.description: Cafodd corff y bachgen pum mlwydd oed ei ddarganfod yn Afon Ogwr yn dilyn adroddiadau fod plentyn ar goll.

item.title: Cyhoeddi llyfrau'r Brifwyl yn hwb i'r byd cyhoeddi
item.description: Roedd colli cyfrolau yr Eisteddfod wedi costio cyfanswm o oddeutu £100,000 i'r diwydiant llyfrau y llynedd.

item.title: Llythyrau caru a thystion: Sut oedd hawlio iawndal ar ôl torcalon
item.description: Elin Tomos sy'n edrych ar hanes y ddeddf Torri Amod Priodas.

item.title: Disgwyl i Crystal Palace benodi Roberts fel is-reolwr
item.description: Mae disgwyl i Osian Roberts ymuno â Crystal Palace fel rhan o dîm hyfforddi y rheolwr newydd Patrick Vieira.
